Package fr.utt.lo02.projet.view.hmi

Class SwingHmiView

java.lang.Object
java.awt.Component
java.awt.Container
javax.swing.JComponent
javax.swing.JPanel
fr.utt.lo02.projet.view.hmi.SwingHmiView
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameView, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class SwingHmiView
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements GameView, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener
Game view using swing hmi this view is based on the Observer pattern, it basically receives events in the propertyChange method and then display and set the correct listener accordingly.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private boolean animate
    Boolean used to say if the animation should proceed or not
    static int ANIMATION_REFRESH_RATE
    Refresh rate of the holograms animations So, the number of milliseconds between two repaint during the animations
    static java.lang.String BACKGROUND_PATH
    Path to the background image file
    private java.awt.image.BufferedImage backgroundImage
    The background image (wood table for now)
    private AbstractBoard boardModel
    The board of the game
    private java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<CardWithScreenCoordinates> boardView
    View of the current board We use a copy of the board in order to manage the drag and drop and the failed action
    static int CARD_HEIGHT
    Card height for the stone image
    static int CARD_WIDTH
    Card width for the stone image
    private CardWithScreenCoordinates cardImage
    The dragged card, this card is the one that follows the user cursor
    private int cardIndex
    The index of the card among the player hand Mainly used for the advanced game
    private GameController controller
    Controller of the game (MVC pattern)
    private CoordinatesConvertor coordinatesConvertor
    Convertor to match game and screen coordinates
    private int currX
    Current abscissa of the dragged card
    private int currY
    Current ordinate of the dragged card
    private boolean displayScores
    Should the scores be displayed (used in the draws method)
    private EndGameScoreDrawer endGameScoreDrawer
    Drawer for the end game display
    private MyButton endRoundButton
    The button to end the round and launch a new one It is displayed during the scores display.
    private EndRoundScoreDrawer endRoundScoreDrawer
    Drawer for the end round display
    private MyButton endTurnButton
    The button that ends the turn It is displayed during the second choice (after the player places a card if he decided to)
    private static java.awt.Font font
    The font used to draw the texts
    private GameState gameState
    Current state of the game model
    private java.util.List<Coordinates> goodRequestsScreen
    List of the correct location for the current player action (Move or place)
    private java.util.List<CardWithScreenCoordinates> handView
    View of the hand of the current player
    static int HOLOGRAM_HEIGHT
    Height of the hologram in pixel
    static int HOLOGRAM_WIDTH
    Width of the hologram in pixel
    static int IA_SLEEP_TIME
    Number of milliseconds between two actions of the virtual players
    static int LEFT_BOARD_OFFSET
    Offset for the board beside the left part of the screen
    private AbstractShapeUpGame model
    Reference to the to be played game
    private MyButton moveButton
    The button to set the move request to the controller This is a button that is placed during the first choice (when the player turns just began)
    private int numberOfFrame
    Current index of the animation frame (between 0 and 7 since our animations uses 8 images)
    static int OFFSET_X
    Offset between two cards in the abscissa axis
    static int OFFSET_Y
    Offset between two cards in the ordinate axis
    private MyButton placeButton
    The button to set the place request to the controller This is a button that is placed during the first choice (when the player turns just began)
    private boolean placementTime
    True if the player can place false if the action is a move
    static int PLAYER_HAND_Y
    Offset for the player hand representation
    private int prevX
    Initial abscissa of the dragged card
    private int prevY
    Initial ordinate of the dragged card
    private MyButton secondMoveButton
    The button to set the move request to the controller This is a button that is placed during the second choice (when the player have placed first)
    private boolean shouldDrawText
    True if the game should display user indications
    private java.util.List<java.awt.Image> sprite
    List of the card (stones)
    private java.awt.Image[][] spriteGlitchAnimations
    Images of the hologram animations for each cards
    private java.util.List<java.awt.Image> spriteHologram
    List of every holograms
    static java.lang.String THREAD_FROM_GAME_VIEW_NAME
    Name of the thread used to call controller method A thread is always used to perform every controller operation This ensures that the thread that call the repaint is a event dispatch one that avoids strange display errors.
    static int TOP_BOARD_OFFSET
    Offset for the board beside the top of the screen
    private int xAdj
    Abscissa offset for drag and drop in order to have the card centered on the user mouse
    private int yAdj
    Ordinate offset for drag and drop in order to have the card centered on the user mouse

    Entry point for the game only (without the initialization menu) The game will be played for 2 real players in a circle board with a basic score calculator and with 2 views (console and swing)

  • Field Details

    • THREAD_FROM_GAME_VIEW_NAME

      public static final java.lang.String THREAD_FROM_GAME_VIEW_NAME
      Name of the thread used to call controller method A thread is always used to perform every controller operation This ensures that the thread that call the repaint is a event dispatch one that avoids strange display errors.

      Parameters:

      Returns:

      Generate the empty location for a movement or a place Those are put in the goodRequestScreen attributes They are represented in the game with yellow and white square

    • instantiateButtons

      private void instantiateButtons()
      Creates the needed buttons with their location and their associated action listener

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      Entry point for the game only (without the initialization menu) The game will be played for 2 real players in a circle board with a basic score calculator and with 2 views (console and swing)
